title: What a look at more than 3,000 kinds of cells in the human brain tells us
description: A wide-reaching look at the cells that build the brain, detailed in 21 studies, showcases the brain’s cellular diversity and clues about how it works.

title: Neandertals hunted cave lions at least 48,000 years ago
description: A new study reports the first direct evidence of Neandertals slaying the big cats, and the earliest evidence of any hominids killing a large predator.

title: Ants may be the first known insects ensnared in plastic pollution
description: At this point, it’s unclear whether this type of trash harms insects, but the discovery highlights the ubiquity of plastic pollution in the wild.
